title: Leviticus Chapter 6 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Leviticus chapter 6 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Leviticus Chapter 6 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Leviticus Chapter 6.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 6:2, what is one example of a trespass against the LORD?
options: Lying to his neighbour in that which was delivered him to keep
Building an altar without permission
Failing to attend the feast
Eating unclean animals
questions.correctAnswer: Lying to his neighbour in that which was delivered him to keep
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:2 specifies that lying to one's neighbour in that which was delivered him to keep is a trespass against the LORD.

questions.question: What must a person do if he has sinned by deceitfully getting something, according to Leviticus 6:4?
options: Restore what he took and add the fifth part more
Offer a burnt offering only
Fast for seven days
Give a tenth of his income to the priest
questions.correctAnswer: Restore what he took and add the fifth part more
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:4 instructs that the sinner must restore what was deceitfully gotten and add the fifth part more.

questions.question: What kind of ram must be brought for the trespass offering as stated in Leviticus 6:6?
options: A ram without blemish
A young goat
A burnt calf
A dove
questions.correctAnswer: A ram without blemish
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:6 commands that the trespass offering should be a ram without blemish.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 6:7, who makes atonement for the sinner bringing a trespass offering?
options: The priest
The sinner himself
The elders of Israel
The prophet
questions.correctAnswer: The priest
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:7 states that the priest shall make atonement for the sinner before the LORD.

questions.question: What must the priest wear when taking up the ashes of the burnt offering, according to Leviticus 6:10?
options: Linen garment and linen breeches
Animal skins
Silk robes
Woolen cloak
questions.correctAnswer: Linen garment and linen breeches
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:10 specifies that the priest shall put on linen garments and linen breeches to take up the ashes.

questions.question: True or False: Leviticus 6:13 says the fire on the altar shall be put out every night.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:13 says the fire shall ever be burning upon the altar and shall never go out.

questions.question: What is done with the remainder of the meat offering after the priest takes a handful to burn as a memorial, according to Leviticus 6:16?
options: Aaron and his sons shall eat it with unleavened bread
It is completely burned on the altar
It is given to the poor
It is buried outside the camp
questions.correctAnswer: Aaron and his sons shall eat it with unleavened bread
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:16 states that the remainder of the meat offering shall be eaten by Aaron and his sons with unleavened bread.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 6:17, what kind of bread shall not be used with the meat offering?
options: Leavened bread
Unleavened bread
Barley bread
Wheat bread
questions.correctAnswer: Leavened bread
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:17 instructs that the meat offering shall not be baked with leaven.

questions.question: What portion of fine flour is offered for the perpetual meat offering as described in Leviticus 6:20?
options: The tenth part of an ephah
One half of an ephah
One third of an ephah
A full ephah
questions.correctAnswer: The tenth part of an ephah
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:20 specifies the offering as the tenth part of an ephah of fine flour.

questions.question: True or False: Leviticus 6:23 states that every meat offering for the priest is to be eaten by him.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:23 says the meat offering for the priest shall be wholly burnt and shall not be eaten.

questions.question: Where shall the sin offering be killed according to Leviticus 6:25?
options: In the place where the burnt offering is killed
Outside the camp
On the mountain
In the holy city
questions.correctAnswer: In the place where the burnt offering is killed
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:25 commands that the sin offering shall be killed where the burnt offering is killed.

questions.question: Who may eat the sin offering as stated in Leviticus 6:26?
options: The priest who offers it
Any Israelite
The elders
The Levites only
questions.correctAnswer: The priest who offers it
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:26 states that the priest who offers the sin offering shall eat it in the holy place.

questions.question: True or False: According to Leviticus 6:29, all male priests shall eat of the sin offering.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:29 clearly states that all males among the priests shall eat of the sin offering.

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'And the priest shall put off his garments, and put on other garments, and carry forth the ashes _________.' (Leviticus 6:11)
options: without the camp unto a clean place
to the altar of burnt offering
into the holy place
to the tabernacle entrance
questions.correctAnswer: without the camp unto a clean place
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:11 instructs the priest to carry the ashes without the camp unto a clean place.

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'This is the law of the meat offering: the sons of Aaron shall offer it _________.' (Leviticus 6:14)
options: before the LORD, before the altar
at the entrance of the tabernacle
in the court of the congregation
on the mountain of the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: before the LORD, before the altar
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:14 states that the sons of Aaron shall offer the meat offering before the LORD, before the altar.

medium.title: Leviticus Chapter 6 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Leviticus Chapter 6 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Leviticus 6 teach us about honesty and integrity in daily life when dealing with a neighbor?
options: Restore what was taken or deceived and add a fifth part more
Ignore the wrongdoing if no one knows about it
Only apologize without making restitution
Ask the priest to forgive without any repayment
questions.correctAnswer: Restore what was taken or deceived and add a fifth part more
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:2-5 instructs that if a person sins by deceiving or lying to a neighbor, they must restore what was taken or withheld and add a fifth part more. This teaches the importance of full restitution and integrity.

questions.question: What practical lesson about repentance and making things right can we learn from the trespass offering described in Leviticus 6?
options: Bring a ram without blemish and make atonement through the priest
Confess silently without any offering
Offer any animal without regard to condition
Rely on self-forgiveness without involvement of others
questions.correctAnswer: Bring a ram without blemish and make atonement through the priest
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:6-7 teaches that the guilty must bring a ram without blemish for a trespass offering and the priest shall make atonement. This illustrates the biblical principle of true repentance involving restitution and intercession.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with guilt after sinning against a neighbor. According to Leviticus 6, what biblical truth would you share about forgiveness?
options: God forgives when restitution and trespass offering are made
Forgiveness comes without any action on our part
Forgiveness is only for major sins, not small ones
Keep the sin secret to avoid shame
questions.correctAnswer: God forgives when restitution and trespass offering are made
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:7 shows that after restitution and bringing the trespass offering, the priest makes atonement and the LORD forgives. This emphasizes that confession, restitution, and seeking God’s forgiveness lead to restoration.

questions.question: How does the command for priests to keep the altar fire burning continually (Leviticus 6:9-13) relate to personal spiritual discipline?
options: Maintain a constant and active devotion to God
Only pray once a week for spiritual growth
Depend on others to keep your faith burning
Ignore daily spiritual practices
questions.correctAnswer: Maintain a constant and active devotion to God
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:9-13 commands the altar fire to burn continuously, symbolizing continual dedication. This teaches the importance of persistent, daily spiritual discipline and devotion.

questions.question: What does Leviticus 6 teach about the importance of holiness and reverence in serving God, especially in the context of the meat offering?
options: The offering must be unleavened and eaten by the priests in a holy place
The offering can be eaten anywhere without restrictions
Leaven is required to symbolize growth
The offering is shared with the whole congregation
questions.correctAnswer: The offering must be unleavened and eaten by the priests in a holy place
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:15-18 explains that the meat offering is to be unleavened and eaten by Aaron and his sons in the holy place, emphasizing holiness, reverence, and separation in service to God.

questions.question: In what way does Leviticus 6 show us a biblical model for stewardship and generosity in worship?
options: Offering a portion of fine flour perpetually, half in morning and half at night
Only giving when you feel like it
Giving leftovers without planning
Offering whatever is left after personal needs
questions.correctAnswer: Offering a portion of fine flour perpetually, half in morning and half at night
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:20-22 describes the continual meat offering of a tenth part of an ephah of fine flour, signifying ongoing stewardship and generous dedication to God’s service.

questions.question: A believer is feeling unworthy to serve God due to past failures. How does Leviticus 6 encourage humility and contentment in serving as a priest or servant of God?
options: All males among Aaron’s children are given a portion and must be holy
Only the most talented can serve God
Service depends on personal merit
God does not require holiness in service
questions.correctAnswer: All males among Aaron’s children are given a portion and must be holy
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:17-18 and 6:29 show that holiness is required and all male priests partake of offerings, teaching that God calls all who are set apart to serve Him humbly and with contentment.

questions.question: How does Leviticus 6 guide us in dealing with temptation to dishonesty in the workplace?
options: Restore what was taken and bring a trespass offering
Hide the truth to keep your job
Blame others for mistakes
Ignore the sin if no one catches you
questions.correctAnswer: Restore what was taken and bring a trespass offering
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:2-7 teaches that sin involving deceit or wrongful taking requires restoration and a trespass offering, highlighting honesty and accountability in all dealings.

questions.question: True or False: According to Leviticus 6, the fire on the altar should be put out at night and rekindled in the morning.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:13 states that the fire shall ever be burning upon the altar; it shall never go out, emphasizing continuous devotion.

questions.question: True or False: Leviticus 6 teaches that the sin offering’s flesh may be eaten by any member of the congregation after the offering is made.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:26 and 6:29 specify that only the priests may eat the sin offering in the holy place, showing respect for holiness and order in worship.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to Leviticus 6, the priest shall carry the ashes of the burnt offering without the camp to a ______ place.
options: clean
unclean
distant
holy
questions.correctAnswer: clean
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:11 commands the priest to carry the ashes without the camp unto a clean place, illustrating respect for ritual purity.

questions.question: What does Leviticus 6 teach us about the role of the priest in interceding for the sinner?
options: The priest makes atonement for the sinner before the LORD
The sinner must atone without the priest
The priest only observes and does not intervene
The priest punishes the sinner personally
questions.correctAnswer: The priest makes atonement for the sinner before the LORD
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:7 explains that the priest makes atonement for the sinner, teaching the importance of intercession and mediation in reconciliation with God.

questions.question: How does the instruction about washing garments sprinkled with blood (Leviticus 6:27-28) teach about holiness and care in service to God?
options: Garments must be washed in the holy place to maintain holiness
Garments can be discarded without washing
Bloodied garments are unimportant
No special care is required for garments
questions.correctAnswer: Garments must be washed in the holy place to maintain holiness
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:27-28 commands washing garments with blood in the holy place, teaching reverence and purity in service to God.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 6, what attitude should one have when offering gifts or sacrifices to God?
options: Offer them with sincerity, holiness, and continual devotion
Give reluctantly and without care
Offer only when convenient
Give gifts that are blemished or impure
questions.correctAnswer: Offer them with sincerity, holiness, and continual devotion
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:9-23 emphasizes offerings being without blemish, perpetual, and accompanied by priestly holiness, encouraging sincere and devoted worship.

questions.question: How does Leviticus 6 instruct believers to handle found property or restitution concerning their neighbor?
options: Restore it faithfully and add a fifth part more
Keep it if no one claims it
Hide it to avoid trouble
Donate it without telling the owner
questions.correctAnswer: Restore it faithfully and add a fifth part more
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:3-5 teaches that found or taken property must be restored and a fifth added, illustrating honesty and love for neighbor.

questions.question: What practical lesson about perseverance through trials can be drawn from the continual fire on the altar in Leviticus 6?
options: Maintain steady, unceasing faith and commitment to God
Give up when spiritual challenges arise
Only seek God occasionally
Let spiritual fervor burn out
questions.correctAnswer: Maintain steady, unceasing faith and commitment to God
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:12-13 commands the altar fire to burn continually, symbolizing perseverance and constant devotion in faith.

hard.title: Leviticus Chapter 6 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Leviticus Chapter 6.

questions.question: What is the required restitution when a person lies about something entrusted to them, according to Leviticus 6?
options: Restore the principal plus a fifth part more
Restore only the principal
Offer a goat as a sin offering
Confess and fast for seven days
questions.correctAnswer: Restore the principal plus a fifth part more
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:4-5 commands that the guilty party must restore what was taken or deceived, adding one-fifth more to it.

questions.question: Which animal is specified for the trespass offering in Leviticus 6?
options: A ram without blemish
A young bull
A lamb
A dove
questions.correctAnswer: A ram without blemish
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:6 specifies that the trespass offering must be a ram without blemish.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 6, what must the priest do with the ashes taken from the burnt offering on the altar?
options: Carry them outside the camp to a clean place
Scatter them in the river
Burn them within the tabernacle
Bury them under the altar
questions.correctAnswer: Carry them outside the camp to a clean place
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:10-11 instructs the priest to carry the ashes outside the camp to a clean place after removing his garments.

questions.question: True or False: The fire on the altar must be kept burning continually and must never be put out.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:12-13 clearly states that the fire on the altar shall be burning continually and must never go out.

questions.question: In Leviticus 6, which offerings may Aaron and his sons eat in the holy place?
options: The remainder of the meat offering (grain offering)
Burnt offerings
Sin offerings where blood is brought inside
All offerings
questions.correctAnswer: The remainder of the meat offering (grain offering)
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:16-18 explains that Aaron and his sons may eat the remainder of the meat offering in the holy place; it is most holy.

questions.question: What is the significance of the meat offering being eaten with unleavened bread in the court of the tabernacle?
options: It symbolizes purity and the absence of corruption
It signifies the inclusion of Gentiles
It represents the Passover meal
It indicates a new covenant
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes purity and the absence of corruption
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:16-17 instructs that the meat offering is eaten with unleavened bread, which in biblical symbolism often represents purity and separation from sin (leaven as corruption).

questions.question: According to Leviticus 6, what is the role of the priest when a trespass offering is brought?
options: To make atonement before the LORD and forgive the sinner
To burn the offering without speaking
To eat the offering in the holy place
To sprinkle the congregation with blood
questions.correctAnswer: To make atonement before the LORD and forgive the sinner
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:7 states that the priest shall make atonement for the sinner before the LORD and forgiveness will be granted.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The sin offering is to be killed in the same place as the burnt offering, because it is _____.
options: Most holy
Common
Ceremonial
Ritualistic
questions.correctAnswer: Most holy
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:25 states that the sin offering must be killed where the burnt offering is killed because it is most holy.

questions.question: What must be done with any garment sprinkled with the blood of the sin offering in Leviticus 6?
options: It must be washed in the holy place
It must be burned immediately
It must be given to the poor
It must be buried outside the camp
questions.correctAnswer: It must be washed in the holy place
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:27 directs that any garment sprinkled with blood of the sin offering be washed in the holy place.

questions.question: What is instructed regarding the earthen vessel used to cook the sin offering?
options: It must be broken
It must be cleansed and reused
It must be buried
It must be sold
questions.correctAnswer: It must be broken
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:28 commands that the earthen vessel in which the sin offering is sodden shall be broken.

questions.question: Which offering is wholly burnt and not eaten by the priests, as stated in Leviticus 6?
options: The meat offering (grain offering)
The sin offering
The trespass offering
The peace offering
questions.correctAnswer: The meat offering (grain offering)
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:22-23 declares that every meat offering for the priest shall be wholly burnt and not eaten.

questions.question: How is the continual nature of the altar fire in Leviticus 6 typologically significant in the broader biblical context?
options: It symbolizes God’s eternal presence and covenant
It signifies the destruction of sin
It foreshadows the temple destruction
It indicates the end of sacrifices
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes God’s eternal presence and covenant
questions.explanation: The perpetual altar fire (Leviticus 6:13) symbolizes God's continuous presence and the unending covenant with Israel, a theme echoed in later scriptures such as Hebrews 7.

questions.question: What does the Hebrew term translated as 'trespass' in Leviticus 6:2 imply about the nature of sin in this context?
options: A deliberate violation requiring restitution and atonement
An unintentional error
A ceremonial impurity
A social dispute only
questions.correctAnswer: A deliberate violation requiring restitution and atonement
questions.explanation: The Hebrew word often translated as 'trespass' (פֶּשַׁע, peshah) in Leviticus 6:2 indicates a willful sin that breaches a covenant, necessitating restitution and atonement.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 6, what is the significance of the priest changing garments before carrying the ashes outside the camp?
options: It represents separation between holy service and common tasks
It is a sign of mourning
It symbolizes cleansing of sin
It indicates the priest’s retirement
questions.correctAnswer: It represents separation between holy service and common tasks
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:10-11 shows the priest putting off his holy garments and putting on others before carrying out the ashes, symbolizing the distinction between sacred duties and common work.

questions.question: Who is authorized to eat the sin offering according to Leviticus 6?
options: All male priests
All Israelites
Only the anointed high priest
No one; it must be burnt
questions.correctAnswer: All male priests
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:29 specifies that all male priests shall eat the sin offering, as it is most holy.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The offering of Aaron and his sons on their anointing day was a perpetual meat offering of _____ fine flour, half in the morning and half at night.
options: a tenth part of an ephah
a quarter part of an ephah
half an ephah
a full ephah
questions.correctAnswer: a tenth part of an ephah
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:20 describes the offering on the day of anointing as a perpetual meat offering of a tenth part of an ephah of fine flour.

theological.title: Leviticus Chapter 6 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Leviticus Chapter 6 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 6, what must a person do if they sin by lying about something entrusted to them or taken by violence?
options: Restore the principal plus a fifth part and bring a trespass offering
Only confess the sin before the priest
Offer a burnt offering without restitution
Make a public apology in the assembly
questions.correctAnswer: Restore the principal plus a fifth part and bring a trespass offering
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:4-5 commands that a sinner restores what was taken or deceived, adding a fifth part more, and brings a trespass offering. This reflects God's justice and mercy, consistent with restitution in Exodus 22:1, Proverbs 6:30-31, and the New Testament call to repentance and restitution in Luke 19:8 and 2 Corinthians 7:10.

questions.question: What kind of offering is to be brought as a trespass offering according to Leviticus 6?
options: A ram without blemish
A male lamb
A bullock without defect
A goat from the flock
questions.correctAnswer: A ram without blemish
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:6 specifies that the trespass offering is a ram without blemish, highlighting the requirement for a perfect sacrifice. This foreshadows Christ, the spotless Lamb (1 Peter 1:19), who offered Himself for sin (Hebrews 9:14, 1 John 3:5).

questions.question: Who makes atonement for the sinner after the trespass offering is brought?
options: The priest
The sinner himself
The elders of Israel
The prophet
questions.correctAnswer: The priest
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:7 states that the priest makes atonement before the LORD so the sinner is forgiven. This priestly mediation prefigures Christ as our High Priest who intercedes for us (Hebrews 7:25, Romans 8:34, 1 Timothy 2:5).

questions.question: What characteristic of the altar fire is emphasized in the law of the burnt offering?
options: The fire shall never go out
The fire shall be extinguished daily
The fire shall only burn during festivals
The fire shall be kept by the people
questions.correctAnswer: The fire shall never go out
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:13 commands that the fire on the altar shall always burn and never be put out, symbolizing God's continual presence and holiness. This perpetual fire signifies God's eternal covenant (Numbers 18:7, Hebrews 7:16).

questions.question: What garments does the priest wear when handling the ashes of the burnt offering?
options: Linen garment and linen breeches
Animal skins
Woolen robes
Silk tunic
questions.correctAnswer: Linen garment and linen breeches
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:10 directs the priest to wear linen garments when removing ashes, symbolizing purity and separation for holy service. Linen garments are associated with holiness in Exodus 28:39 and Revelation 15:6.

questions.question: How is the meat offering described in terms of its preparation and consumption?
options: Baked with oil and eaten by Aaron and his sons with unleavened bread
Boiled and shared with the whole congregation
Roasted over fire and eaten by the priests only
Raw grain offered and burnt completely
questions.correctAnswer: Baked with oil and eaten by Aaron and his sons with unleavened bread
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:15-16 explains the meat offering is baked with oil and eaten by Aaron and his sons with unleavened bread in the holy place, signifying holiness and the priestly portion. This reflects the principle of sacred gifts in Numbers 18:8-9 and the priestly role in mediating between God and people.

questions.question: What is the status of the meat offering in relation to leaven, and what does this signify?
options: It shall not be baked with leaven, signifying purity and separation
It shall be mixed with leaven, symbolizing growth
Leaven is optional according to the priest's discretion
Leaven is used only during festivals
questions.correctAnswer: It shall not be baked with leaven, signifying purity and separation
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:17 prohibits leaven in the meat offering, reflecting the biblical symbolism of leaven as sin or corruption (1 Corinthians 5:6-8, Exodus 12:15). The offering's purity underscores God's holiness and the need for unblemished gifts (Hebrews 9:14).

questions.question: What is the perpetual meat offering for Aaron and his sons on the day of anointing?
options: A tenth part of an ephah of fine flour, half in the morning and half at night
A lamb without blemish once a week
A bullock for atonement yearly
Two goats, one for the LORD and one for Azazel
questions.correctAnswer: A tenth part of an ephah of fine flour, half in the morning and half at night
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:20 describes the perpetual meat offering given to Aaron and his sons at their anointing, emphasizing continual dedication and service. This continuity anticipates Christ's eternal priesthood (Hebrews 7:23-24).

questions.question: What must be done with the sin offering in terms of its place and consumption?
options: Killed where the burnt offering is killed and eaten by the priest in the holy place
Slaughtered outside the camp and burnt entirely
Offered only during the Day of Atonement and eaten by the people
Sacrificed on a mountaintop and buried
questions.correctAnswer: Killed where the burnt offering is killed and eaten by the priest in the holy place
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:25-26 commands the sin offering be killed at the same place as the burnt offering and eaten by the priest in the holy place, signifying the priest's role in bearing sin for the people. This foreshadows Christ’s atoning sacrifice and intercession (Hebrews 10:12-14).

questions.question: What is the requirement for garments that have blood sprinkled from the sin offering?
options: They must be washed in the holy place
They must be burned immediately
They can be washed anywhere
They are to be discarded outside the camp
questions.correctAnswer: They must be washed in the holy place
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:27 instructs washing garments stained by sin offering blood in the holy place, emphasizing ritual purity and the sanctity of the sanctuary. This points to God's holiness and the seriousness of sin (Exodus 29:4, Hebrews 9:13).

questions.question: What is done with the earthen vessel used to cook the sin offering?
options: It must be broken
It is purified and reused
It is buried outside the camp
It is given to the priests
questions.correctAnswer: It must be broken
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:28 requires that the earthen vessel used for the sin offering be broken, symbolizing the destruction of impurity and the serious nature of sin. This contrasts with reverence for holy utensils, reflecting God's demand for holiness (Exodus 32:20, 2 Kings 18:27).

questions.question: Who is permitted to eat the sin offering according to Leviticus 6?
options: All the male priests
Any Israelite
Only Aaron himself
The Levites generally
questions.correctAnswer: All the male priests
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:29 states that all male priests may eat the sin offering, emphasizing the priestly privilege and responsibility in dealing with sin. This priestly participation anticipates Christ’s role as our High Priest (Hebrews 5:1-4).

questions.question: What must be done with any sin offering whose blood is brought into the tabernacle for reconciliation?
options: It shall be burnt with fire
It shall be eaten by the priests
It shall be buried outside the camp
It shall be offered again
questions.correctAnswer: It shall be burnt with fire
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:30 commands that any sin offering whose blood is brought into the tabernacle shall not be eaten but burnt, highlighting the holiness and finality of atonement. This underscores the seriousness of sin and God's righteous requirements (Hebrews 9:12, 1 John 1:7).

questions.question: What is the theological significance of the perpetual fire on the altar as taught in Leviticus 6?
options: It symbolizes God's eternal holiness and continual acceptance of worship
It represents human effort in maintaining the covenant
It is a symbol of Israel's victory in battle
It signifies the end of sacrifices after the temple destruction
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes God's eternal holiness and continual acceptance of worship
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:12-13 stresses the fire shall never go out, symbolizing God's perpetual presence and holiness. This eternal fire is a sign of God’s covenant faithfulness seen also in the continuous lampstand (Exodus 27:20-21) and the New Testament imagery of God’s eternal throne fire (Revelation 4:5).

questions.question: How does the law of the trespass offering in Leviticus 6 reflect God's justice and mercy?
options: By requiring restitution plus an additional fifth and a sacrificial offering
By only requiring confession without restitution
By punishing the sinner without any offering
By forgiving without any action from the sinner
questions.correctAnswer: By requiring restitution plus an additional fifth and a sacrificial offering
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:4-5 shows God’s justice in requiring full restitution and a penalty (a fifth part more), while mercy is expressed by the provision of a trespass offering for atonement. This balances God's holiness and grace, reflected in passages like Psalm 85:10 and Romans 3:25.

questions.question: What does the instruction about the meat offering being a 'memorial' burnt for a sweet savour to the LORD imply about worship?
options: Worship involves remembrance and pleases God
Worship is only about sacrifices without meaning
Worship is optional and not important
Worship is for human satisfaction only
questions.correctAnswer: Worship involves remembrance and pleases God
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:15 states the meat offering is a memorial burnt for a sweet savour to the LORD, indicating worship is both remembrance and acceptable to God. This aligns with Hebrews 13:15 and Psalm 141:2 where worship is a pleasing aroma to God.

questions.question: What does the eating of the remainder of the meat offering by Aaron and his sons signify in the context of Leviticus 6?
options: The priest’s share in God's provision and service
The people's participation in the sacrifice
The offering’s impurity
A symbolic rejection of the offering
questions.correctAnswer: The priest’s share in God's provision and service
questions.explanation: Leviticus 6:16-18 indicates the priests eat the remainder of the meat offering, signifying their portion and sustaining role in God's service. This reflects the priestly role seen in Numbers 18:8-20 and foreshadows Christ as the eternal priest who shares in the people’s redemption (Hebrews 7:27).
